# Creating the sticker

This is a short tutorial to easily create your own stickers!

Let's give it a try for this group and find our identity! ðŸ™ƒ

## 00. Libraries

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| message: false

library(tidyverse)
library(magick)
library(hexSticker)
library(sysfonts)

```

## 01. Prepare images

```{r}
hack01 <- magick::image_read('../images/hackathon.png')
hack02 <- magick::image_read('../images/hackathon_02.png')
hack03 <- magick::image_read('../images/coding.png')
```

## 02. Load fonts

```{r}

fonts <- font_files()

# Check font paths
# font_paths()

# Add the font we want
font_add(family = "Bahnschrift", regular = "C:\\Windows\\Fonts\\bahnschrift.ttf")

```

## 03. Stickers

### Defining colors palette
```{r}
# define pallete
palette <- list('background' = '#d8f3dc',
                'font' = '#4d908e',
                'border' = '#0a9396',
                'note' = 'grey25')

# Single Palette elements
background_color = '#d8f1ef'
font_color = "#272640"
border_color = "#1b3a4b"
note_color = "black"

# Or we may just call the colors at each place if we are rotating options
```

### Option 01
```{r}
hex_hack01 <- sticker(
  # Title
  package = "AgHackathon",
  # Title attributes
  p_family = "Bahnschrift",
  p_color = "#272640",
  p_size = 40,
  p_y = 0.6,
  # Image
  subplot = hack01,
  # Image attributes
  s_width = 1.1,
  s_height = 1.1,
  s_x = 1,
  s_y = 1.18,
  # Hexagon attributes
  h_fill = '#d8f1ef',
  h_color = "#1b3a4b",
  h_size = 2,
  # Add a link
  url = "image: Flaticon.com",
  u_size = 5,
  u_color = note_color,
  # Add spotlight
  spotlight = F,
  # Spotlight attributes
  # add some shadow to the pictures
  l_y = 1,
  l_width = 3,
  l_height = 3,
  l_alpha = 0.5,
  # File saving
  filename = "AgHackaton_logo_01.png",
  dpi = 600,
  white_around_sticker = FALSE
  ) 

hex_hack01
```
